alert.note: Alert for Harlan; Leslie; Letcher; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 8:40PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Harlan, Letcher, central Leslie, Perry, Knott, southeastern Floyd and southwestern Pike Counties through 930 PM EDT... At 839 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Elmrock to Hazard to near Bledsoe. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Hindman, Yellow Mountain, Jeff, Vest, Cordia, Elmrock, Viper, Tina, Bearville and Fisty around 845 PM EDT. Vicco, Wiscoal, Anco, Sassafras, Mousie, Bolyn, Soft Shell, Elic, Garner and Leburn around 850 PM EDT. Evarts, Pippa Passes, Kildav, Bailey Creek, Verda, Darkmont, Smithsboro, Larkslane, Putney and Hollybush around 855 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Letcher, Blackey, Kenvir, Black Mountain, Redfox, Short Town, Colts, Demo, Raven, Cody, Bath, Wheelwright, Isom, Sackett, Hi Hat, Buckingham, Burton, Amelia, Dizney, Price, Whitesburg, Ligon, Polly, Tillie, Buckhorn Hollow, Melvin, Holmes Mill, Lester, Crown, Van, Farraday, Winters, Craftsville, Millstone, Sergent, Southdown, Virgie, Mayking, Lucastown, Jonancy, Fleming-Neon, Whitaker, Wright, Neon Junction, Tolliver Town, Seco, Thornton, Chip, Cromona and Haymond. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 51 and 59. Kentucky Highway 80 in Knott County between mile markers 1 and 16. Kentucky Highway 80 in Perry County between mile markers 9 and 15. U.S. Highway 23 in Lethcher County between mile markers 1 and 7. U.S. Highway 23 in Pike County between mile markers 0 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
